name: O'Callaghan Davenport Hotel

reviews.title: Good location, tired but clean.
reviews.text: Great location - very central but not noisy. Pleasant staff. Offsite parking at good rate. Rooms tired but clean. When available at the <€100 rate it is good value, over that and there are Orr options. Have stayed here often and it is consistent.

the hotel is just not in the center of things its ideal if you want a hotel in a quiet area. I feel this hotel would suit the older person who likes the old style hotel. the rooms are clean,we got a room on the sixth floor over looking some type of air pipes, which came on in the morning and did not turn off till 11 o clock at night as we were checking out i informed the staff of the hotel as i feel this ruined my stay at this hotel, even though i can't complain about the service, the food, or the staff, i would not stay here again as our sleep was not great with the noise outside our window
reviews.title: old style hotel

reviews.text: Location wasn't RIGHT in the middle of things - but it was close enough to plenty of attractions & Trinity and 1 block away from the valuable Hop-on-Hop-Off bus tour, which was perfect. The slight distance allowed for a good quiet sleep.
reviews.title: Great room, only decent stay

reviews.text: Our temperature control was way off (the air wouldn't turn on) and the staff brought up fans and opened our window rather than acknowledge the problem.
reviews.title: Great Location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 5 nights, location is great. Hop on Hop Off bus is around the corner across from the hotel. Room was good, bathroom fine. Glad I brought my travel hair dryer, there is one in the bath but not very good. Comfy bed, thermostat for heat/ac which we did use. Room nicely cleaned everyday. Worst thing about this hotel is there is not any wifi, not even in the lobby. You have to pay I think 2.99 euro for 1 hour & that is not wireless. OR pay 12.99 euro for 24 hours which would be wireless in your room. Anyway, we never did pay to get it. And each time you use the phone, even w/card, you get charged .50 cents. Other than that, which I guess is inconsequential, it was a good place & extremely convenient to lots of sites, cafes, etc.
reviews.title: Another Great Experience

reviews.text: The Davenport is a beautiful hotel that is centrally located in Dublin. Well, sort of. Its location is nice in that it is only a short walk from iconic sites in Dublin, but is in a quieter corner. My only issue with it is that it does not have free wifi. I have stayed in a lot of B&Bs in Ireland and all of them had free wifi, so it confuses me why a nice hotel doesn't have FREE wifi.
reviews.title: Brilliant...but no free wifi

reviews.text: What I was very impressed with was the fact that they have an American and a European plug next to the Irish/UK plugs. This was nice since I accidentally left my adapter at the last place I stayed in. Wish there was more than 1 plug though.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Staff

reviews.text: Stayed overnight at this fine property on the 17th May, there was a bit of confusion over the booking. However the very pleasant receptionist spent sometime with us and in the end sorted out the booking. The room was excellent and the room facilities were great. The service in the bar was first class, but we had one problem. We ordered breakfast for 6:30am that was fine, but the service was bad. Coffee was served at 6:30 and until I questioned the service, we did not receive our continental breakfast until 7:00. Bad show. So from the service being excellent it fell to poor.
reviews.title: Very ordinary

reviews.text: Hotel room was okay but no mini bar / fridge, its tired and you have to pay for wifi! Breakfast was a disaster ... Long wait for a table, dirty plates and no glasses... A classic example of system overload as there were 2 tour groups as well as normal travellers like us. In fairness we complained and never paid for the breakfast but we wont stay there again.
reviews.title: Rude staff led by a very rude manager

reviews.text: A poor welcome at reception, basic bedrooms (not even 3* standard), appalling service at breakfast and when we asked to offer our opinion to the manager, he was very unhelpful and disinterested.
reviews.title: Not good value for money

reviews.text: Surprised with the lack of services at the price we paid.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it offers

reviews.text: No bell desk. No concierge. Plus we had to pay for wireless Internet, a first during our two week vacation.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, there was a huge tour bus out front, forcing us to carry our luggage from a block down.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms.

reviews.text: We felt rooms were small and dingy for the money.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The employees were great. The location is close to many landmarks. Very convenient. Comfy beds.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel 8 times since it first opened - each time I loved its location, spacious room, efficient servce and good breakfasts. The location and spacious rooms are still there. This trip I arrived only to be told they has no record of my booking despite me producing an accommodation voucher from alpharooms. A number of searches of the reservation system were made to no avail. A reception offered to nook me hotels elsewhere. Ecentually my details were found..my first name had been entered as part of my surname...by someone evidently unfamiliar with how family names work in the UK and Ireland. Stressful and unacceptable.
reviews.title: Not what it was?

reviews.text: \the other disappointment was breakfast - tasteless coffee, minimal freshfruit or yoghurt.
reviews.title: no free wifi

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights and was surprised that they don't offer free wifi. Most hotels now offer this and I resent having to pay extra for it. My room was very spacious and I appreciated the 2 different types of outlets. I asked the front desk for a wakeup call my first night and overslept the second day because they did not do it. Evidently it can either be called on the telephone or through the TV ---this was not explained to me until after it was a moot point but in any event I was not called. This hotel is centrally located.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL IN A GREAT CITY

reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and totally loved it, went to Dublin to see Westlife Concert at Croke Park which was amazing. The receptionist was so nice when we arrived as was everyone through out our stay. The room was clean and so peacefull, we began to think we were the only people staying it was so quiet. We had dinner in the restaurant twice which was delicious. the only complaint would be waiting around 45mins from ordering. The hotel is only a 20 min walk from Grafton Street and the hop-on hop-off bus. We went to the Guiness Storeshouse and when we came out we hopped the bus again because their is a bus at all the stops throughout the tour every 12mins. sadly it was soon time to go home and the taxi the hotel booked for us was so helpfull, he asked what terminal we were going to, we did not know, when we told him we were flying to aberdeen he said that would be terminal 1, but if we had to go to terminal 2 it was a short way on the escalator. Dublin is a wonderfull city with friendly people can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Convienent to the City

reviews.text: Stayed here at late notice and got a room on the fifth floor which was clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Nice stay

description: Located on a quiet corner in the heart of Dublin City, only moments away from the buzz of city life, the O’Callaghan Davenport Hotel Dublin is where history and modernity unite. A fusion of old and new is a distinctive feature of this traditional, elegant Dublin City centre hotel. Imaginatively decorated in warm, vibrant colours, the 4-star Davenport Hotel Dublin has been designed with style and comfort in mind. Upon arrival at the Davenport Luxury hotel Dublin City you will be greeted by the hotel’s striking facade, distinguishing it from any other. It is all that remains of the landmark building, Merrion Hall Just off Merrion Square Dublin City, designed by Alfred G Jones in 1863, after a fire engulfed the building in 1990. The interior refurbishment and exterior restoration has been sensitive to the historic nature of the building. There are a host of facilities available for the business or leisure guest at the O’Callaghan Davenport Luxury Hotel Dublin. Rich dark woods engulf President’s Bar, creating an inviting, clubhouse ambience, where residents and locals stop to unwind and enjoy a drink, coffee, or light lunch. Lanyon’s Restaurant is famed for its relaxed atmosphere and tasty European fare. If fitness is your relaxant, there is a 24-hour gymnasium for exclusive use of hotel residents at Dublins Davenport Hotel. The discerning business guest is certain to feel at home in O’Callaghan Davenport Luxury Hotel. There is a wide range of facilities at your disposal in the business centre, open 24-hours, while wireless broadband is available in the lobby. As flexibility and choice is a core value of O’Callaghan Hotels, guests can use the facilities and services of any Dublin City O’Callaghan Hotel and have the account conveniently billed back to your room.
